text:
You underestimate the power of good prompts.

Here are 5 frameworks to copy & paste:

1 – T-A-S-K
☑ Define the (Task / Goal)
☑ Name the (Audience)
☑ Cite the (Source)
☑ Set a (KPI)

Example:
☑ TASK: Create a LinkedIn post
☑ AUDIENCE: Gen-Z software engineers
☑ SOURCE: Attached employee-survey quotes
☑ KPI: Optimise for CTR ≥ 3%

2 – P-L-A-N
☑ State the (Problem)
☑ List the (Limits)
☑ Add the (Assets)
☑ Note the (Needed Output)

Example:
☑ PROBLEM: Warehouse picking time too high
☑ LIMITS: $50k capex
☑ ASSETS: SKU velocity spreadsheet
☑ NEEDED OUTPUT: One-page slide deck

3 – C-O-D-E
☑ Clarify the (Context)
☑ Specify the (Output Format)
☑ Provide the (Data)
☑ Establish an (Evaluation)

Example:
☑ CONTEXT: Security audit of Flask app
☑ OUTPUT FORMAT: OWASP-style Markdown report
☑ DATA: Attached app files
☑ EVALUATION: Flag CVSS ≥ 7.0

4 – G-A-I-N
☑ State the (Goal)
☑ Identify the (Audience)
☑ Inject the (Input)
☑ Nail the (Numeric Target)

Example:
☑ GOAL: Lift seat expansion
☑ AUDIENCE: Enterprise buyers
☑ INPUT: Last-quarter usage logs
☑ NUMERIC TARGET: +25%

5 – R-E-S-T
☑ Assume the (Role)
☑ Compile the (Evidence)
☑ Choose the (Style)
☑ Define the (Target Metric)

Example:
☑ ROLE: Academic literature mapper
☑ EVIDENCE: 15 research papers
☑ STYLE: Bullet-friendly, technical
☑ TARGET METRIC: Cap read-time at 4 minutes
